title: 112_hr4219
content: The Act titled "Consumer Protection Home Inspection Counseling Act of 2012" is about home inspection counseling. Section 1451 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act is amended to include new requirements for FHA-approved lenders. The Secretary must publish a Mortgagee Letter within 90 days of the enactment of the Consumer Protection Home Inspection Counseling Act of 2012. The Consumer Protection Home Inspection Counseling Act of 2012 amends Section 1451 of the Dodd-Frank Act to include new requirements for HUD-approved counseling agencies. Housing counselors must be trained through a voluntary home inspection training module and distribute counseling aids. The Consumer Protection Home Inspection Counseling Act of 2012 amends Section 1451 of the Dodd-Frank Act to include new requirements for HUD-approved counseling agencies. Housing counselors must be trained through a voluntary home inspection training module and distribute counseling aids. The Secretary may withhold, withdraw, or suspend housing counseling certifications for any housing counselor or counseling entity that fails to meet the requirements of this section. The Secretary shall establish a comprehensive training program for staff, contractors, and entities providing housing. The Secretary shall establish a training program for housing counselors, including development of training materials for consumers on voluntary home inspection. Training materials must be written in plain language and comprehensible to consumers without ongoing assistance. The Secretary shall establish a training program for housing counselors, including development of training materials for consumers on voluntary home inspection. The program shall provide Internet website references for homebuyers to locate local professional home inspectors. The home inspection counseling program must convey that a home inspection is voluntary, not mandatory. The Department of Housing and Urban Development recommends that homebuyers obtain a voluntary home inspection, which is an in-depth examination of the physical structure and internal systems of the home. It is not required for FHA loans, and should be done by a trained professional. The Department of Housing and Urban Development recommends that homebuyers arrange for a voluntary home inspection to examine the physical structure and internal systems of the home. It is the homebuyer's responsibility to request and pay for a home inspection, as it can provide financial benefits by identifying potential repairs that the seller may cover. The Department of Housing and Urban Development recommends that homebuyers consider requesting a voluntary home inspection before closing. The Secretary will develop guidance materials for housing counselors on how to advise consumers on selecting a professional home inspector. The Secretary will develop a new protocol to certify housing counselors under section 106 of the Housing and Urban Development Act. Standards for voluntary home inspection counseling materials will be established. The Secretary will establish standards for voluntary home inspection counseling materials and submit a report to Congress within 12 months of the enactment of the Consumer Protection Home Inspection Counseling Act of 2012, detailing compliance actions, results achieved, areas for improvement, and recommendations for enhancement.
